intro: Spirotheca rimbachii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, long-lasting flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant belongs to the family Gesneriaceae and is prized for its ornamental value in horticulture. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish.
